content: This post is showing the link to a workshop I did using Singularity on Hoffman2 (UCLA’s HPC cluster). This Workshop took place via Zoom on April 29, 2021. The repo containing the pdf and zoom recording is located on UCLA’s IDRE gitlab site https://gitlab.idre.ucla.edu/workshops/singularity_ws The is workshop is a basic lecture on using singularity to using containers on Hoffman2. There are example containers in the gitlab repo, showing sample containers of with python and packages like TensorFlow and PySCF. Also a example using GPU containers. Stay tuned for more updates on Singularity on Hoffman2!
title: Singularity Workshop

content: Program Quill I have updated on GitHub a small, very simple Hartree Fock program, mostly written in C. I mostly wrote this code as a test to program Hartree Fock. I am thinking of adding more functions. The code is located on my GitHub page https://github.com/charliecpeterson/QUILL This program uses PySCF and libcint to generate the 1e/2e integrals. It also uses the Eigen3 API for all Matrix/linear algbra routines. The input is very similar to NWChem. This code ONLY does RHF. Single reference, closed-shell systems ONLY I have tested this on a few compounds and it is about 10^-2 AU in energy different from results from PySCF. More work is needed. I’m thinking of using this program as a starting point to add and test new libraries to run computational chemistry methods, esp to the Exascale. Contact Me for any more information!
